citeinfo.title: COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014: Mined-Out Areas in the Hymera Coal Member in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
This shapefile contains information that is related to two additional GIS data sets produced by the Indiana Geological Survey:
1) COAL_MINE_UNDERGROUND_IN: Underground Coal Mines in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile)
2) COAL_MINE_SURFACE_IN: Surface Coal Mines in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile)

descript.abstract: COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 is a polygon-based ESRI ArcGIS shapefile that shows the location and extent of the mined-out areas in the Hymera Coal Member in the coal region of west-central and southwestern Indiana. COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 includes mine locations from documented surface and underground mines that operated in Indiana since the late 1800s. COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 is attributed to allow the mine polygons to be differentiated based on mine number, county name, and mine type (surface or underground).
descript.purpose: COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 is a composite of all surface and underground mined-out areas in the Hymera Coal Member in Indiana. COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 incorporates all Hymera Coal Member surface and underground mined-out areas compiled by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) digitized from maps collected from the Indiana Department of Natural Resources Division of Reclamation, the Indiana Bureau of Mines, coal companies, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, several series of aerial photographs, and U.S. Geological Survey 7.5-minute quadrangle maps. All mined-out data included in COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014 are organized in a GIS using ArcGIS software of the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI) on the Windows platform. Scale of source data ranges from 1:4,800 to 1:100,000. COAL_MINE_SURFACE_IN includes attributes that allow the mine polygons to be differentiated based on mine number, county name, and mine type (surface or underground).

attracc.attraccr:
Two tests for attribute consistency were performed by IGS personnel using the QueryBuilder Tool in ArcView:
(1) Completeness of values was verified. No values were left blank.
(2) Validity of values was verified. All features were attributed with values in the appropriate range and format.

dataqual.complete: All surface and underground mined-out areas in the Hymera Coal Member in Indiana included in this shapefile were compiled as part of the Indiana Coal Mine Information System (CMIS) project at the Indiana Geological Survey. The CMIS is an integrated geographic information system and database management system created to maintain spatial and tabular data related to coal mines in the Indiana portion of the Illinois Basin. The CMIS includes spatial mine data compiled from all known sources including: company mine maps (from the Indiana Division of Reclamation, Indiana Bureau of Mines, coal companies), field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, several series of aerial photographs, and U.S. Geological Survey 7.5-minute quadrangle maps. In compiling data for the CMIS, every effort was made to ensure data accuracy and completeness. However, it is known that undocumented surface mining has occurred in the study area. Also, because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual extent of surface mining may not coincide with the boundaries portrayed in this shapefile. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a specific site may differ from this shapefile.

horizpa.horizpar: Mined-out areas included in this shapefile were compiled from several sources with varying map scales. Thus, the horizontal positional accuracy of individual polygons may vary. If highly detailed mine location and layout information is needed, contact the Indiana Geological Survey for additional information. Because of inconsistency in source map quality and completeness, the actual extent of surface mining may not coincide with the boundaries portrayed in this shapefile.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the creation of COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.title: 1:24,000-scale surface and underground coal mine maps

srcinfo.srccitea: Surface and underground mine quadrangle maps

procstep.procdesc: Mined-out areas in the Hymera Coal Member from a variety of sources including company mine maps, field maps and notes of IGS geologists, IGS publications, several series of aerial photographs, and U.S. Geological Survey 7.5-minute topographic maps were rescaled and hand-plotted on 1:24,000-scale quadrangle maps. This data set, comprising of more than 100 quadrangle maps, was compiled by IGS personnel in the mid-1980s to create the first complete compilation of surface and underground mine locations in Indiana.

Polygons from the Indiana Geological Survey 1:24,000-scale surface and underground mine coal maps were digitized by Indiana Geological Survey personnel in the late 1980s to create the first coal mine GIS for the IGS and the Indiana Division of Reclamation. Outlines were digitized using ESRI PC ArcInfo and georeferenced using eight tics from 1:24,000-scale quadrangle maps.

Data from the early coal mine GIS were converted to a new GIS format and updated with new mine data. Using ESRI ArcInfo ver. 7.2.1, polygons were extracted from the old GIS coverages and integrated into a new REGION-based GIS format. Each polygon was attributed with source information, dates of mining, and coal seam data. The resulting reformatted mine coverages (more than 4,000 including underground and surface coal mines) constitute the primary mine GIS data for the Indiana Coal Mine Information System, an integrated geographic information system and database management system. In addition to the reformatting, more than 1,000 mine coverages were added to the GIS, including approximately 225 new surface mines, 20 new underground mines, and nearly 1,200 historic underground mine entrance locations.

CMIS mine data were updated with information collected for the Directory of Coal Mines and Producers in Indiana - 2000. The update included approximately 40 surface mine polygons and 5 underground mine polygons. Most data were received in digital format from mining companies and converted to suitable format by IGS personnel.

Mine coverages from the Indiana Coal Mine Information System were appended using an AML running in ESRI ArcInfo version 7.2.1. This coverage was then projected to UTM zone 16 NAD 83 using the ESRI ArcView Projector extension.The resulting coverage included all mines in the Indiana coal region. COAL_MINE_SURFACE_IN was created in ESRI ArcView by using the ESRI ArcView QueryBuilder to select only surface mines and then by using the convert-to-shapefile command to create a new shapefile from the selected data.
ArcInfo surface mine coverages were converted to an ESRI personal geodatabase feature data set.

Active surface and underground mines outlines, and mined-out areas were digitized to update the data from affected-area maps collected annually from the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation and the Indiana Bureau of Mines.

Active surface mine outlines and underground mines outlines, and mined-out areas were digitized to update the data from affected-area maps collected annually from the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation and the Indiana Bureau of Mines.

Active surface mine and underground mines outlines, and mined-out areas outlines were digitized to update the data from affected-area maps collected annually from the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, Division of Reclamation and the Indiana Bureau of Mines.
Mined-out areas in the Hymera Coal Member in Indiana were extracted and the COAL_MINE_ACTIVE_HYMERA_IN_2014 was created.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following citation should be included: [COAL_MINE_MINED_OUT_HYMERA_IN_2014: Mined-Out Areas in the Hymera Coal Member in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, 1:24,000, Polygon Shapefile), data compilation by Licia Weber and Rebecca Meyer, 2014].
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove Avenue, Bloomington, Indiana 47405 2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.

The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
